radiographic_examinations.findings: Looser zones (lucent bands perpendicular to the cortex).

radiographic_examinations.date: Five years later, during a routine dental evaluation
radiographic_examinations.findings: Slight alteration in the trabecular pattern of the right mandible.

radiographic_examinations.date: Five years later, during a routine dental evaluation
radiographic_examinations.findings: A destructive lesion (1.2 cm in diameter) in the right mandibular body, with marginal trabecular preservation.
Positive for radionuclide uptake in the right mandible, consistent with persistent or recurrent tumor.
Radiolucency associated with the right anterior mandibular implant.
No soft-tissue calcifications and no evidence of stress fractures.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: SPECT imaging of the head, chest, and abdomen
radiographic_examinations.findings: High uptake in the lower face, thought to be in the mandible or reconstructed bone; subtle localization in the upper abdomen thought to be nonspecific.

radiographic_examinations.date: After administration of intravenous contrast material
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules (≤9 mm in diameter), small mediastinal and axillary lymph nodes, nodules in the periscapular subcutaneous fat bilaterally (≤6 mm in diameter), and diffuse sclerosis of the thoracic skeleton.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Pulmonary metastases were unchanged on the follow-up CT scan 8 months later.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral punctate, nonobstructing renal calculi and an 8-mm lytic lesion in the fourth lumbar vertebral body, unchanged from a previous study.
